revised_title: The Role of Brain Hormone in Blood Retention and Oocyte Development in Mosquitoes
tldr: The study investigates the role of brain hormone, specifically the egg development neurosecretory hormone (EDNH), in the retention of blood in the mid-gut and the development of oocytes in female mosquitoes. The research shows that the medial neurosecretory cells of the brain are responsible for retaining the blood in the mid-gut until the oocytes are nearing maturity. The findings suggest that EDNH plays a crucial role in this process, and further research is being conducted to understand its direct or indirect actions.
